The chain method

A value which has a Chain must provide a chain method. The chain method takes one argument.

m.chain(f)
  1. f must be a function which returns a value
    1. If f is not a function, the behaviour of chain is unspecified.
    2. f must return a value of the same Chain.
  2. chain must return a value of the same Chain.

1st Law: Associativity

m.chain(f).chain(g) is equivalent to m.chain((x) => f(x).chain(g))

export associativity = (f) -> for-all (Int).satisfy (a) -> g = (a) -> f (a * 2) h = (a) -> f (a - 1) return (f a).chain(g).chain(h).is-equal (f a).chain (x) -> g(x).chain h
